title: Fired Employees Warned They Would ‘Pay a Price’ for Participating in ‘Day Without Immigrants’ | Josh | DC101
text:
Fired Employees Warned They Would ‘Pay a Price’ for Participating in ‘Day Without Immigrants’ posted by @JoshOnDC101 - share 
The owner of a masonry business in Colorado is speaking out about his decision to fire more than 30 employees who did not show up for work in support of last week’s “Day Without Immigrants” protest. 
Jim Serowski , the owner of JVS Masonry, told CNN in an interview on Sunday he did nothing wrong and said he warned his employees about the consequences of joining in the protest movement before they actually took the day off.
